abstract: Andrew Cuomo, the New York state attorney general, on Monday demanded settlements from three banks as it continues its inquiry into the collapse of auction-rate securities, after his office had helped negotiate agreements with Citigroup and UBS last week.
snippet: Andrew Cuomo, the New York state attorney general, on Monday demanded settlements from three banks as it continues its inquiry into the collapse of auction-rate securities, after his office had helped negotiate agreements with Citigroup and UBS la...
lead_paragraph: Updated: Morgan Stanley said late Monday that it will buy back up to $4.5 billion in auction-rate securities from retail investors.

headline.main: Cuomo Seeks Settlements With 3 More Banks
